title: Tape patterns
content:
The indicator is designed to process and filter “raw” order stream, flowing into the market. It has very sensitive settings to compute different automatic download algorithms and positions unloading.
Here are a few things Tape Patterns will enable you to do:
- You will be able to detect max and min volume in the current prints chain
- You will be able to use this volume to filter
- You will be able to see time in milliseconds between the desired prints
- You will see the number of ticks in range
- You will be able to detect trade side (buy/sell).
The indicator takes into account all this data and displays it on the chart.

IMPORTANT! To optimize the load on the server, the indicator data is displayed only for the current session.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Time filtration

NameDescription
Use time filter This setting enables the application of a time-based filter for the indicator. When activated, the indicator will only analyze and display data for candles that fall within a specified time range. If turned off, the indicator considers candles from all time frames.
Time from This parameter sets the starting time for the time filter.
Time to This parameter establishes the end time for the time filter.

Calculation

NameDescription
Cumulative Trades A mode in which only cumulative transactions are used in calculations.
Min Print Volume Volumes that are less than the value set in this filter will be ignored.
Max Print Volume Volumes greater than the value set in this filter will be ignored.
Minimum trades count Defines the minimum number of trades allowed for calculation.
Maximum trades count Defines the maximum number of trades allowed for calculation.
Min Cumulative Volume Defines the minimum volume for cumulative trades allowed for calculation.
Max Cumulative Volume Defines the maximum volume for cumulative trades allowed for calculation.
Time Filter Defines the maximum size of the time period for carrying out some calculations.
Search prints inside time filter If activated, the calculation incorporates only cumulative trades where the time span between the conclusion and initiation of the trade does not surpass a predefined duration.
Range Filter Defines the maximum number of price levels for calculation.
Calculation Mode Represents one of the available data source types.

Options:
  • Any
  • Bids
  • Ask
  • Between
  • Bid or Ask
  • Bid and Ask

Visualization

NameDescription
Visual Objects Transparency Visual Objects Transparency
Cluster Selection Transparency Similar to the visual objects transparency, this setting adjusts the transparency of highlighted elements within clusters, allowing for finer control over their visual appearance.
Fixed Sizes When this option is turned on, all volumes will be displayed with a similar size, regardless of their actual volume. This can be useful for standardizing the visual representation of different volumes on the chart.
Size This parameter sets the standard size for selections on the chart.
Maximum Size Indicates the maximum size for the shape.
Minimum Size Indicates the minimum size for the shape.
Visual Mode The visual mode setting determines how selections are displayed on the chart

Options:
  • Ellipse
  • Triangle
  • Rectangle
  • Diamond
  • Only price

Colors

NameDescription
Between color Defines the color for elements displaying over-the-counter trades.
Buys Sets the color of the element representing the buy signal.
Sells Sets the color of the element representing the sell signal.

Alerts

NameDescription
Use alerts Enables or disables the sound notification.
Alert File This parameter allows users to specify the name of a custom audio file for alert sounds. Users can select a WAV file that will be played whenever an alert condition is triggered. The chosen WAV file should be located in the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\ATAS Platform\Sounds.
